page.title: 13Doctor Cooper from Insch.
page.content: When we visited Dr.Cooper he was within one month of his 102nd birth_ day.We had to shout quite loudly before he could hear our questions but he was happy to answer them all. He was born in Kennethmont in 1883.He lives in Dunnydeer House which his father built in 1909 for Â£1200. His earliest memories are of his schooling in the building in Commerce Street,now "Simpson's Garage".When he was twelve he went to Aberdeen Grammar School,but his father was disappoined with the results so he was moved to Gordon's College where he was very happy and successful. In 1901 he went to Aberdeen Univer_ sity,qualifying as a doctor in 1906. He wanted to get into the R.A.M.C. but this was not to be.So his father sent a telegram to a friend, Dr.Durno, in London.
